div.div: Read our latest News and Bulletin

h2.a:
Preschool Expansion
Click Here for Information

td.br: Important Message - April, 27, 2020 Board of Education Meeting

td.a: April 21, 2020 Food Services Department Letter to Parents
td.br: In response to Governor Murphy's decision to extend remote learning, the Gloucester Township Public Schools Food Service Department will continue to distribute meals to all students who currently have either a free or reduced price meal status.

td.a: Strategies for Managing Anxiety & Stress During COVID-19
td.br:
Strategies for Managing Anxiety & Stress During COVID-19 Workshop
Hosted by Caitlin Summers, LPC,
Program Supervisor, First Children Services

td.a: April 16, 2020 - Governor Murphy Extends School Closures
td.br: This letter is to provide an update on the status of the district’s remote learning and resulting school building closures.
I am pleased to announce some exciting news about Preschool Expansion for next year.
Beginning on April 1, 2020 resident parents and/or guardians will be able to preregister their child for Kindergarten in Gloucester Township Public Schools.

In the spirit of transparency and a shared vision of safety for all students our district has enabled the GoGuardian Parent, which is an app that gives parents and guardians the opportunity to monitor their children's browsing activity.

td.a: Department of Special Education - Remote Learning
td.br: I hope this finds your family well and safe during COVID-19. We appreciate your support and are proud of the work your children are producing with your support.
Covid-19 Preparedness Plan for Gloucester Township Public Schools
This letter is to provide an update on the status of the district’s remote learning and resulting school building closures.

In response to Governor Murphy’s executive order and in exercising an abundance of caution, as
of tomorrow (March 23, 2020), the Gloucester Township School District Administration and
Administrative support staff will be working remotely.

td.a: March 22, 2020 COVID-19 Grab & Go Meal Update
td.br: In response to Governor Murphy’s directive to stay at home, Gloucester Township Public School’s Food Service Department will reduce the days for "Grab & Go" Breakfast & Lunch meal distribution.
Use this link for technology support related questions and concerns.

In response to the Superintendents decision to implement remote learning, the Gloucester
Township Public Schools Food Service Department has been developing a plan to feed our
children who currently have either a free or reduced price meal status.
A message for part-time and hourly staff of Gloucester Township Schools.

As a school district, we have been closely monitoring the news regarding the spread of the
coronavirus disease or COVID-19. Please follow the link for detailed information.

The basis of this message is to update all parents in regards to the coronavirus and the impacts to
our district. The most significant change will be the immediate escalation of distributing home
instruction materials to certain students.

td.a: Comcast is offering their low income family package for FREE for the next 60 days
td.br: As the country deals with the effects of the Coronavirus (COVID-19), Comcast is taking immediate steps to help connect more low-income families to the Internet at home. Effective Monday, March 16, 2020, anyone who signs up for Internet Essentials will receive two free months of Internet service.
An update to parents and guardians on our district's preparations as concerns over COVID-19 increase.
